title: Carbon Reduction Strategies in Education Through Digital Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Strengthening practical strategy development capabilities for achieving carbon neutrality goals in digital transformation environments, targeting corporate education administrators

learning_goals: Developing an action plan to reduce carbon emissions by over 30% when operating education using digital tools

Learners will design a carbon neutrality education model within 6 months, utilizing an online platform (e.g., LMS) and offline workshops (quarterly, once per quarter), incorporating three core modules: carbon emission calculation, renewable energy application strategies, and carbon offset project design. They will submit a prototype report meeting internal evaluation criteria (module completeness ≥80%, feasibility ≥70%).
Diagnosing the current state of carbon emissions in corporate education and proposing improvement strategies

Learners will identify three organizational/cultural barriers (e.g., resistance culture, technical deficiencies, misaligned workflows) that may arise during digital education transitions. They will propose at least two actionable solutions (e.g., tool utilization plans, communication protocols) per barrier and ensure validity through peer review, achieving an average score of ≥4 on a 5-point scale.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
